translations.translation: What is the matter with them that they run from the Reminder
Why then do they turn away from the admonition
What is the matter with people that they are turning away from this Exhortation,
If such will be the Day of Judgment, what is the matter with them? Why do they run away from guidance,
So what is the matter with them that they turn away from the advice?
Then what is wrong with them that they turn away from admonition
What is then the matter with them, that they turn away from the admonition
What ails them, that they turn away from the Reminder,
Why now turn they away from the Admonishment,
Then what is wrong with them that they turn away from admonition,
What aileth them, therefore, that they are from the Admonition turning away?
What is the matter with them that they evade the Reminder
Then what is the matter with them that they turn away from admonition?-
Then what is wrong with them (i.e. the disbelievers) that they turn away from (receiving) admonition?
What is the matter with them that they turn away from this Reminder,
Why are they turning away from the Reminder?
Then what is [the matter] with them that they are, from the reminder, turning away

[74:49] So what (fa-mā: the subject) is wrong with them (lahum: the predicate thereof, semantically connected to an omitted clause, the person of which has been transposed onto it) that they turn away (mu‘ridīna is a circumstantial qualifier referring to the [suffixed] pronoun [in lahum, ‘them’]) from the Reminder — in other words, ‘what has happened to them that they have turned away from admonition’ —
(Why now turn they away from) disbelieve in (the Admonishment) the Qur'an

commentaries.author: الجيلاني
commentaries.text:
{ فَمَا لَهُمْ } وأيّ شيء عرض لهم ولحق بهم
 مع أنهم مجبولون على فطرة التوحيد واليقين
 حتى صاروا { عَنِ ٱلتَّذْكِرَةِ } التي هي آيات القرآن المبيِّنة لسرائر التوحيد والعرفان { مُعْرِضِينَ } [المدثر: 49] منصرفين على سبيل الإنكار والاستكبار
